alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 7:16AM CDT until September 04 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Cherokee. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 716 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Moshat, Eastern Weiss Lake, Tennala, Western Weiss Lake, Howells Crossroads, Coloma and Waterhouse.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
